name: Sauced: Garlic Chili Oil
description: I'm a chili oil fiend. If there's any near me, it goes on everything. Luckily, it's super easy to make at home, which only further fuels the chili head in me while opening up the doors to more hot oil possibilities. In this version, I went with equal parts crushed red pepper and garlic with fantastic results.

recipeInstructions.text: Place oil, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a small sauce pan over low heat. Cook until garlic starts to brown and pepper darkens, but doesn’t blacken, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature, 1 to 2 hours.
Strain oil through a fine mesh strainer into a glass jar. Use immediately or store in refrigerator for up to 10 days, allowing to come to room temperature before use.
